Item (form/schedule/scenario): Plain 1099‑DIV with small amounts (no Schedule B required)
Why (short reason): TT “simple return” includes interest/dividends that don’t require Schedule B.

Item (form/schedule/scenario): 1099‑DIV where Schedule B **is** required (>$1,500 dividends or foreign account question)

Why (short reason): QBI from REIT dividends computed on Form 8995; Deluxe supports 1099‑DIV/Sch B level needs.

Item (form/schedule/scenario): 1099‑DIV with capital gain distributions Box 2a (and/or 2b/2d categories)
Why (short reason): Investments/Sch D/8949 are handled in Premium; product page highlights stocks/bonds/crypto.
Investments support (stock/crypto sales) is a Premium feature.
K‑1 entry requires Premier/Premium or higher in Online.
K‑3 foreign items entry supported when using investment/advanced tiers.

Item (form/schedule/scenario): Foreign tax credit (Form 1116) from 1099‑DIV Box 7 or K‑3
Why (short reason): Handled within investment/advanced tier; often accompanies K‑3/foreign items.
No extra per‑K‑1 software fee; Premium remains required for any K‑1.

Item (form/schedule/scenario): Multi‑state returns (nonresident states due to K‑1 property)
Why (short reason): Online supports multiple state returns; each state is an additional fee.

Item (form/schedule/scenario): Nonresident state filing (K‑1 state source income)
Requires (Online) Tier: Any paid tier + **state add‑on for that state**
Why (short reason): You’ll add a nonresident state module (additional state fee applies).
